keyTakeAways: A majority of Americans (56%) now view Donald Trump as a potentially dangerous dictator, up from 52% in April 2025.
45% of Americans strongly agree that Trump is a dangerous dictator; 43% strongly agree he is waging an assault on constitutional balances and the rule of law.
This sentiment includes a significant number of independents, suggesting the issue is not purely partisan.
The 'No Kings' rallies, initially dismissed by Republicans as extremist or nonsensical, have resonated with a majority of Americans due to concerns over unchecked executive power.
Public concern about presidential overreach predates Trump, but has intensified under his leadership; comparisons to past leaders like Obama and Biden show a distinct difference in perception.
Polling data from 2024 and 2025 indicates that Americans increasingly believe a president has 'too much' power, rising from 32% (under Biden) to 54% (under Trump).

summaryOfNewsArticle: The article analyzes a recent poll by the Public Religion Research Institute showing that a strong majority of Americans — 56% — now view Donald Trump as a potentially dangerous dictator, with nearly half strongly agreeing, and 54% seeing him as waging an assault on constitutional balances. This sentiment has grown since April 2025, indicating a rising public concern over executive overreach. Despite Republican attempts to dismiss the 'No Kings' rallies as extremist or nonsensical, the polling reveals that the message resonates with many Americans, including independents. The article contextualizes this concern by showing that similar worries existed in past presidential administrations — such as under Obama or Biden — but are now more pronounced under Trump. The data suggests a broader public anxiety about unchecked presidential power, even as political figures like Mike Johnson, Meghan McCain, and Brit Hume debate the validity of the 'King' metaphor. Ultimately, the article concludes that the 'No Kings' movement reflects a real and growing sentiment among Americans who fear Trump is abusing his authority beyond democratic norms.
title: Republicans are ridiculing ‘No Kings.’ A striking new poll shows Americans aren’t laughing
